lessons.title: Calling In Sick
lessons.storyDesc:
- Hello! Daniel speaking, how may I help you?
+Hi Daniel, Julie here.
- Hi Julie! How are you?
+ Actually, I'm feeling quite ill today.
- Oh! I'm sorry to hear that. What's wrong?
+ I think I'm coming down with the flu.
I have a headache, sore throat, a runny nose, and I'm feeling slightly feverish.
- Oh! So you're calling in sick.
+ Yes, I was hoping to take the day off to recover.
- Ok then try and get some rest.
lessons.descriptionDesc:
- Hello! Daniel speaking, how may I help you?
+Hi Daniel, Julie here.
- Hi Julie! How are you?
+ Actually, I'm feeling quite ill today.
- Oh! I'm sorry to hear that. What's wrong?
+ I think I'm coming down with the flu.
I have a headache, sore throat, a runny nose, and I'm feeling slightly feverish.
- Oh! So you're calling in sick.
+ Yes, I was hoping to take the day off to recover.
- Ok then try and get some rest.

cards.question:
- I don't think I can go to work today. I'm feeling -------------.

کامل کنید: خیلی مریض
cards.description:
Quite ill means very sick.
Quite ill is mostly used in British accent.

cards.question:
I'm feeling very sick. I think I have the ---------.

کامل کنید. (انفولانزا)
cards.description:
Flu or influenza is a kind of sickness.
It is similar to a cold but it is more severe.

cards.question:
- Do you have a painkiller? I have a very bad -------.

کامل کنید. (سردرد)
cards.description: If you have a headache, your head hurts. You have a sore head.

cards.question:
- Are you feeling ok?
+ No, I have a --------.

کامل کنید. (گلودرد)
cards.description:
If you have a sore throat it means that your throat hurts.
The word sore means painful and it can be used with other body parts too.

For example you may have hurt your arm and have a sore arm, or if you move your head very fast you may end up with a sore neck.

cards.question:
- Can I have a tissue? I have a ------.

کامل کنید. (آبریزش بینی)
cards.description: When you have a runny nose, there's lots of water coming out of your nose.

cards.question:
- Can you take my temperature please? I'm feeling ------- -------------. 

کامل کنید: یکم تب دارم (دو کلمه)
cards.description:
Fever is having high body temperature.
Slightly means a little bit.
Slightly feverish is the feeling of your body being hot.

cards.question:
- I can't go to school today. I'm feeling very sick. I need to stay home to -------.

کامل کنید: بهتر بشم.
cards.description:
to recover means to get better.

For example:

I had a very busy week. I need to recover this weekend.

cards.question:
- I have a sore throat. I think I'm ---------------------------.

کامل کنید.
(starting to get sick) (the flu)
cards.description:
I'm coming down with something
This expression is used when you feel that you're starting to get sick.

Pay attention to these examples.

- You don't look good. I think you're coming down with something. 

- I have a sore throat. I think I'm coming down with the flu.

cards.question:
- I'm coming down with the flu. I don't think I can come to work today, I'm ---------------.

 (کامل کنید (سه کلمه
cards.description: This expression is used for when you are not feeling well, and you have to call to inform your boss that you won't go to work that day.

cards.question:
- I'm very tired today today, I think I'm going to --------------.

کامل کنید: امروز کار نکنم
cards.description:
To take the day off is to not go to work on that day.

You may also take the week off or even take the month off.

lessons.title: Hotel Upgrade
lessons.storyDesc:
- Good afternoon, what can I do for you?
+ I'd like to check in please. I have a reservation under the name Anthony Roberts.
- Alright! Roberts ... oh! Mr Roberts, we've been expecting you, and here is your key card to the presidential suite.
+ But there must be some mistake, my reservation was for a standard room.
- Are you sure? Let me double check.
+ yeah! Here, this is my confirmation number.
- You're right Mr Roberts! There seems to be a mix-up. Unfortunately, we are overbooked at the moment.
+ So... .
- Not to worry. We're pleased to offer you a complimentary upgrade.
+ Woohoo! Presidential suite baby!
lessons.descriptionDesc:
- Good afternoon, what can I do for you?
+ I'd like to check in please. I have a reservation under the name Anthony Roberts.
- Alright! Roberts ... oh! Mr Roberts, we've been  expecting you, and here is your key card to the presidential suite.
+ But there must be some mistake my reservation was for a standard room.
- Are you sure? Let me double check.
+ yeah! Here, this is my confirmation number.
- You're right Mr Roberts! There seems to be a mix-up. Unfortunately, we are overbooked at the moment.
+ So... .
- Not to worry. We're pleased to offer you a complimentary upgrade.
+ Woohoo! Presidential suite baby!

cards.question:
- Do you have a reservation ---------?

کامل کنید: به نام من
cards.description:
When you make a reservation at a restaurant or hotel, they usually ask for your name, so that they know who to expect.

For example:

- My secretary made a reservation under my name.
+ I'm sorry sir, we don't have a reservation under that name. 
- Do you have a reservation under the name Smith?

cards.question:
- I'm so sorry there has been a terrible -------. We have given you the wrong baby.


کامل کنید. (کلمه دو بخشی)
cards.description:
A mix-up is a confusion or a misunderstanding.

Pay attention to this example.

- There was a mix-up and my bags were sent to Antarctica.

cards.question:
- Do you have a table for two?
+ No, I'm sorry it's a busy day we are ---------.


(more than full)  کامل کنید
cards.description:
Overbooked means full or more than full.

For example, when there are so many people in a restaurant or a hotel that they cannot accept any more people, they are overbooked.
A bus or a train can also be overbooked.

cards.question:
I had an economy class ticket for my flight but they were overbooked for some reason and they moved me to first class.

What is this situation called?
cards.description: A complimentary upgrade is when a an airline or a hotel offers you a better opportunity or service for a cheaper price because they are overbooked.

lessons.title: I need an assistant
lessons.storyDesc:
- Like I told you before, we just don't have the resources to hire you an assistant.
+ I understand that, but the fact is we are understaffed.
- The timing is just not right, the economy is bad, and it's too risky to take on new staff.
+ Yeah, I guess you're right. Here is an idea, what if we hire an intern? She would take some of the weight off my shoulders.
- She?
+ Yeah! You know, a recent graduate. She could give me a hand with some of these projects and we could keep our costs down.
- That sounds reasonable, let me see what I can do.



- Tony, I'd like to introduce you to your new assistant.
+ Ok! Great! Let's meet her!
× Hi! I'm Adam.
+ Oh! Hi! I'm Tony.
lessons.descriptionDesc:
- Like I told you before, we just don't have the resources to hire you an assistant.
+ I understand that, but the fact is we are understaffed.
- The timing is just not right, the economy is bad, and it's too risky to take on new staff.
+ Yeah, I guess you're right. Here is an idea, what if we hire an intern? She would take some of the weight off my shoulders.
- She?
+ Yeah! You know, a recent graduate. She could give me a hand with some of these projects and we could keep our costs down.
- That sounds reasonable, let me see what I can do.



- Tony, I'd like to introduce you to your new assistant.
+ Ok! Great! Let's meet her!
× Hi! I'm Adam.
+ Oh! Hi! I'm Tony.

cards.question:
- I have a lot of projects to do. I think I should hire an ---------------.


کامل کنید: دستیار
cards.description: An assistant is someone who helps you.

cards.question:
- We don't have enough ------------ to hire a new assistant.

(کامل کنید (پول
cards.description: In this context resources means money.

cards.question:
- We only have 3 employees in this section, we are ---------.


کامل کنید. (یک کلمه - کارمند کافی نداریم)
cards.description: We are understaffed means that we don't have enough workers.

cards.question:
- Honey I think we should have a baby. 
+ ----------------------.


کامل کنید (الان زمان مناسبی نیست - ۶ کلمه)
cards.reply: the timing is just not right
cards.description:
The timing is just not right means that it's not the right time. 

For example:

- I was going to sell my house but the timing is just not right.

cards.question:
- I need an assistant who can take some of the ------------------------------.


کامل کنید: باری رو از رو دوشم برداره.
cards.description: To take a weight off one's shoulder means to help them out or to do some of the work for them.

cards.question:
- Can you please ----------------- with these boxes.


کامل کنید (کمکم کنید - ۴ کلمه)
cards.description:
Give me a hand means help me. 

For example: 

- Let me give you a hand with your suitcase.

cards.question:
- I lost my job. We need to ------------------ this month. 


کامل کنید: صرفه جویی کنیم/هزینه ها را پایین نگه داریم.
cards.description:
To keep the costs down is to try not to spend much money. 
If you want to keep your costs down you should eliminate unnecessary expenses.

cards.question:
- I don't have enough experience for this job. I should work as an --------- first.


کامل کنید: کارآموز
cards.description:
An intern is a person who works for a company with a low salary or no salary at all to gain experience and learn about the job. 

Sometimes, if an intern performs well, the company hires them as an employee.

lessons.title: Cut In Line
lessons.storyDesc:
- I can't believe it took us 2 hours to get here. The traffic in New York is unbelievable!
+ Yeah, but just relax honey. We're here, we're going on vacation. In a few hours we'll be in Hawaii and you'll be on the golf course.
- I don't know... look at that line. It must be a mile long! There is no way I'm waiting for another 2 hours! 
+ Honey, don't!
× hey man, the end of the line is over there.
- Yeah... .
× No, seriously! I was here first, and you can't cut in line like this.
- Says who?
× I do 
- So sue me!
× Alright, that's it!
lessons.descriptionDesc:
- I can't believe it took us 2 hours to get here. The traffic in New York is unbelievable!
+ Yeah, but just relax honey. We're here, we're going on vacation. In a few hours we'll be in Hawaii and you'll be on the golf course.
- I don't know... look at that line. It must be a mile long! There is no way I'm waiting for another 2 hours! 
+ Honey, don't!
× hey man, the end of the line is over there.
- Yeah... .
× No, seriously! I was here first, and you can't cut in line like this.
- Says who?
× I do 
- So sue me!
× Alright, that's it!

cards.question:
- I'm so late. Can I please ---------------- ?


کامل کنید: (خارج از نوبت توی صف بایستم)
cards.description:
When you're waiting in a line and someone comes and stands in front of you they are cutting in line.

Pay attention to these examples:

- I hate it when people cut in line in the bank. It's so rude!
+ I think it's OK when pregnant women cut in line.

cards.question:
- Ugh! We won't get there on time, the traffic is --------------. 


کامل کنید: باور نکردنی
cards.description: Unbelievable means incredible or amazing. However, in this context it is used to show one's frustration from traffic.

cards.question:
-Where will you be tomorrow morning?
- --------- in the office.


کامل کنید: خواهم بود
cards.reply:
I'll be
or 
I will be
cards.description:
I will be 
you will be 
she/he will be
We will be
They will be

Using will plus be is a great way to describe one's physical location in the future.

For example:

In a few hours, we'll be at the beach.

cards.question:
- Look at this line! It must be ----------!


کامل کنید (سه کلمه - کنایه از خیلی طولانی)
cards.description:
When someone uses the expression "A mile long" to describe something that is obviously shorter than a mile, they are exaggerating.
It is a mile long means that it is very long.

cards.question:
- The stadium is so crowded! ---------------------- we'll find a seat.


کامل کنید: غیر ممکنه (۴ کلمه)
cards.description:
There's no way means that it's impossible. 

Pay attention to these examples:

- There's no way I can have those reports finished today.

- Do you think Mike is going to buy that house?
+ There's no way he has the money.

cards.question: How do you say "cut in line" in British accent?
cards.description: To jump the queue means to cut in line.

cards.question:
- Hey! You can't cut the line like this? 
+ Well, I am. -----------.

کامل کنید: ازم شکایت کن
cards.description: The literal meaning of sue me is to take me to court, but it is mostly used sarcastically. It is a rude expression to say that no one can stop you from doing what you want.

lessons.title: Road Trip
lessons.storyDesc:
-So, are we all ready to go?
+ Yup! I think so, the car is packed, we have munchies and music, and the map's in the car.
- Did you get the camera?
+ Got it. Did you fill up the tank?
- Yup, it's all set! 
+ You're sure we're not forgetting anything?
- I'm sure. We've got all our bases covered.
+ Well, let's get going then. I love road trips.

- Do you think we can make a pit stop? 
+ But we've only been on the road for 10 minutes.
- I know, but I forgot to go to the bathroom before we left.
lessons.descriptionDesc:
-So, are we all ready to go?
+ Yup! I think so, the car is packed, we have munchies and music, and the map's in the car.
- Did you get the camera?
+ Got it. Did you fill up the tank?
- Yup, it's all set! 
+ You're sure we're not forgetting anything?
- I'm sure. We've got all our bases covered.
+ Well, let's get going then. I love road trips.

- Do you think we can make a pit stop? 
+ But we've only been on the road for 10 minutes.
- I know, but I forgot to go to the bathroom before we left.

cards.question:
- Did you buy airplane tickets for your trip?
+ No I prefer to drive. I love ----------.


کامل کنید: سفرهای جاده ای.
cards.description: A road trip is a journey made by car.

cards.question:
- Did you put the bags in the car?
+ Yes, ---------------------.

کامل کنید. (۴ کلمه - همه وسایل مورد نیاز توی ماشینه)
cards.description: When everything you need (the bags, food, etc.) is inside the car, the car is packed.

cards.question:
- I've bought some snacks that we can eat on the way.

در جمله بالا چه کلمه ای می تواند جایگزین 
snacks 
شود
cards.description: Munchies means snacks or food like chips, cookies, etc.

cards.question:
- It's going to be a long road trip, I must ---------------------.

کامل کنید: باک بنزین رو پر کنم
cards.description: To fill up the tank means to put gas in the car.

cards.question:
- We are running out of gas, we have to make a --------- soon.

کامل کنید: توقف کوتاه
cards.description: A pit stop is a quick stop to buy food or gas.

cards.question:
- I've got my keys, passport, and my wallet, it looks like ---------------------------------.

کامل کنید: هر چیزی که نیاز داشتم برداشتم (۷ کلمه)
cards.reply: I've got all my bases covered
cards.description:
I've got all my bases covered means that I have everything ready or I am all prepared.

Pay attention to this example:

- We've got all our bases covered in case the hurricane hits.

cards.question:
- I have the chicken prepared, ------------------.


کامل کنید: بیا آشپزی رو شروع کنیم 
(cook)
cards.description:
Let's get cooking means let's start cooking.
This expression originates from the expression let's get going, which means let's start or let's go.

With some small changes, this expression can have various meanings.

cards.question:
- I have a meeting after this, ------------------.


کامل کنید: بیا کار رو شروع کنیم (6 کلمه)
cards.description: let's get down to business means let's start working.

cards.question:
- This place is scary, ---------------.


کامل کنید: بیا از اینجا بریم. (۶ کلمه)
cards.description: let's get out of here means let's go or let's leave.

cards.question:
- Did you pack the car?
+ Yes, it's ready.

در مکالمه بالا چه جمله ای می تواند جایگزین 
it's ready 
شود
cards.description: It's all set means it's ready or it's prepared.

lessons.title: Virus
lessons.storyDesc:
- Oh great! The stupid computer froze again. That's the third time today.
- Hey! Samuel, can you come take a look at my PC? It's acting up again, it must have a virus or something.
+ Just give me a second, I'll be right up.

+ I ran a virus scan on your computer and it turns out that you have a lot of infected files.
- But I'm quite careful when I'm browsing the Internet. I have no idea how it could have picked up a virus.
+ Well, you have to make sure that your anti-virus software is updated regularly. Yours wasn't up to date. That's probably what was causing your problems.
- OK, anything else?
+ Yeah, try not to kick or hit the computer. 
- Oh! Yeah, sorry about that.
lessons.descriptionDesc:
- Oh great! The stupid computer froze again. That's the third time today.
- Hey! Samuel, can you come take a look at my PC? It's acting up again, it must have a virus or something.
+ Just give me a second, I'll be right up.

+ I ran a virus scan on your computer and it turns out that you have a lot of infected files.
- But I'm quite careful when I'm browsing the Internet. I have no idea how it could have picked up a virus.
+ Well, you have to make sure that your anti-virus software is updated regularly. Yours wasn't up to date. That's probably what was causing your problems.
- OK, anything else?
+ Yeah, try not to hit or kick or hit the computer. - Oh! Yeah, sorry about that.

cards.question: - My computer is not working properly, I think it might have a ----------.
cards.description: A virus is a program designed to harm or damage the computer.

cards.question:
- I need to fix my PC, I was working with it but it suddenly -----------.

کامل کنید: کار نکرد (یک کلمه)
cards.description: We say the computer froze when it suddenly stops working and its programs and applications don't run anymore.

cards.question:
- No wonder your computer froze. You have a lot of ----------------.


کامل کنید: فایل های آلوده به ویروس
cards.description: An infected file is a file with a virus in it.

cards.question:
- Your anti-virus program is not --------------.


کامل کنید: بروز
cards.description:
When something is not up-to-date, it doesn't have all the most recent information. It's old. 

Pay attention to these examples:

- I can't find the street, are you sure this map is up-to-date?

- I need to buy a new PC, mine is not up-to-date.

- Sarah has just finished the report, all the data is up-to-date.

- This map is new, it's up-to-date.

cards.question:
- Honey, dinner's ready, come downstairs.
- ----------------.

کامل کنید: الان میام پایین (۵ کلمه)
cards.description:
Pay attention to these examples:

- Can you help me with my computer? It froze again.
+ Sure, I'll be right there. 

- Hurry up I need to use the bathroom. 
+ I'll be right out.

cards.question:
- I was feeling unwell recently. ----------------- I'm pregnant.

کامل کنید: معلوم شد
cards.description:
Pay attention to this example:

- Frank didn't come to work today and it turns out that he was sick.

cards.question:
- I really need to change my phone, it's been ------------- recently.


کامل کنید: (۲ کلمه) (درست کار نمیکنه)
cards.description: When something is acting up, it's acting strangely or not working properly.

lessons.title: What's your name again?
lessons.storyDesc:
A: Nick! How’s it going?
B: Oh, hey...
A: What are you doing in this neighbourhood? Do you live around here?
B: Actually, my office is right around the corner.
A: It was great to meet you last week at the conference. I really enjoyed our conversation about foreign investment.
B: Yeah, yeah, it was really interesting. You know, I’m in a bit of a hurry, but here’s my card. We should definitely meet up again and continue our discussion.
A: Sure, you still have my contact details, right?
B: You know what, this is really embarrassing, but your name has just slipped my mind. Can you remind me?
A: Sure, my name is Ana Ferris. Don’t worry about it; it happens to me all the time. I’m terrible with names too.
lessons.descriptionDesc:
A: Nick! How’s it going?
B: Oh, hey...
A: What are you doing in this neighbourhood? Do you live around here?
B: Actually, my office is right around the corner.
A: It was great to meet you last week at the conference. I really enjoyed our conversation about foreign investment.
B: Yeah, yeah, it was really interesting. You know, I’m in a bit of a hurry, but here’s my card. We should definitely meet up again and continue our discussion.
A: Sure, you still have my contact details, right?
B: You know what, this is really embarrassing, but your name has just slipped my mind. Can you remind me?
A: Sure, my name is Ana Ferris. Don’t worry about it; it happens to me all the time. I’m terrible with names too.

cards.question:
- Can you please drive faster? ------------------------------.

کامل کنید: یکم عجله دارم. (۸ کلمه)
cards.reply: I'm in a bit of a hurry
cards.description:
I'm in a bit of a hurry means that I don't have time and I'm trying to move quickly.

I'm in a hurry.

Pay attention to these examples:

- I can't talk right now I'm in a bit of a hurry.

- I'm in a bit of a hurry, so I'll check these files later.

cards.question:
- I would love to talk to you again? Can you give me your -----------?


کامل کنید. (۲ کلمه) 
(email, phone number, name, etc.)
cards.description:
Contact details are the information you can find on a business card, like their name, phone number, email address, etc.
In other words, the information that helps people get in touch with you.

cards.question:
- I'm so sorry I forgot to respond to your email, it completely -----------------.


کامل کنید. (۳ کلمه)
cards.description:
Slipped my mind means I forgot. 

Pay attention to these examples:

- Do you know what day is today?
+ Oh! it's your birthday! It completely slipped my mind.

- Did you get milk?
+ Oh no! It slipped my mind.

cards.question:
- I need to take some cash, is there an ATM ---------------.


کامل کنید: این اطراف
cards.description:
Around here means close by.

You can make new sentences by changing this phrase: 
- There's a supermarket right around the corner. (on the other street)

- New York is a great city! I used to live around there.

cards.question:
- I can't even remember my own phone number, I'm ---------------- numbers.

کامل کنید. (۲ کلمه)
cards.description:
When you're terrible with something, you're bad at it or you can't do it properly. 

Pay attention to these examples:

- I'm terrible with directions, I'm always getting lost.

- I'm terrible with faces, I can never remember what people look like.

cards.question:
- Oh hey! How are you?


در جمله بالا چه عبارتی می تواند جایگزین 
how are you 
شود؟ (۴ کلمه)
cards.description: "How's it going" is very similar to "how are you" or "how are you doing" but it's more natural and casual.

lessons.title: Silence please!
lessons.storyDesc:
A: Those people in front of us are making so much noise. It’s so inconsiderate!
B: Don’t worry about it; it’s not such a big deal.
A: Oh... I can’t hear a thing! Excuse me, can you keep it down?
C: Sure, sorry about that!

A: Someone’s phone is ringing!
B: Honey, I think it’s your phone. Did you forget to switch it off?
A: Oh, no! You’re right. That’s so embarrassing!
C: Do you mind keeping it down? I’m trying to watch a movie here!
lessons.descriptionDesc:
A: Those people in front of us are making so much noise. It’s so inconsiderate!
B: Don’t worry about it; it’s not such a big deal.
A: Oh... I can’t hear a thing! Excuse me, can you keep it down?
C: Sure, sorry about that!

A: Someone’s phone is ringing!
B: Honey, I think it’s your phone. Did you forget to switch it off?
A: Oh, no! You’re right. That’s so embarrassing!
C: Do you mind keeping it down? I’m trying to watch a movie here!

cards.question:
- This woman just cut in line, that is so ---------------.


کامل کنید: بی ملاحضه (یک کلمه)
cards.description:
If someone is inconsiderate, they are not thinking about the feelings of other people. 

For example, if the subway is crowded and there's an old man standing and no one's offering their seat to him, that is inconsiderate.

cards.question:
- I'm trying to study here, do you mind ------------------?

کامل کنید: ساکت باشید. (۳ کلمه)
cards.description:
Keep it down means be quiet. 

Pay attention to these examples:

- Your music is so loud! Do you mind keeping it down? It's after midnight.

- Do you mind keeping it down? I'm trying to watch the game.

cards.question:
- I'm really sorry. I'm going to be 10 minutes late.
+ --------------------------. Peter and Mike are late too.

کامل کنید: مشکل بزرگی نیست. (۶ کلمه)
cards.description:
Not a big deal means not a big problem.

Pay attention to this example:

- I can't get these files due by tomorrow.
+ Don't worry about it, it's not a big deal.

cards.question:
- Oh no! My phone's ringing!
+ Turn it off!


در مکالمه بالا چه عبارتی می تواند جایگزین
turn it off
شود؟
cards.description:
Switch it off means turn it off.

There are three ways you can use this verb.
- Did you switch off your phone?
- Did you switch your phone off?
- Did you switch it off?

cards.question:
- What? Are you talking to me? The music is so loud! ---------------.

کامل کنید: هیچی نمی شنوم. (۵ کلمه)
cards.description:
I can't hear a thing means I can't hear anything.

Pay attention to thie example:

- What's going on?
+ I don't know, I can't hear a thing.

cards.question: - I forgot my wallet, do you -------- paying for dinner?
cards.description:
Do you mind is a formal way to ask someone to do something. It is usually meant to be polite but sometimes depending on the tone it can be sarcastic and rude. 

Pay attention to these examples:

- Do you mind holding my coat for me please?

- This is a library. Do you mind turning off your phone?

lessons.title: I'm in Debt
lessons.storyDesc:
A: Hello, I’m here to see Mr. Corleone.
B: Right this way, sir.

C: Charlie! What can I do for you?
B: Mr. Corlone, I’m really sorry to trouble you, but I need your help.
C: Anything for you, Charlie! Your father was like a brother to me.
B: Well, sir, you see, this recession has hit me pretty hard; I lost my job and I’m in a lot of debt.
C: I see……
B: Yeah, you know, I’ve got credit card bills, car payments, I’ve got to pay my mortgage; and on top of all that, I have to pay my son’s college tuition.
C: So you’re asking for a loan.
B: Well, I just thought maybe you could help me out.
C: What? At a time like this? I’m broke too, you know! You’re not the only one who has been hit by the recession! I lost half my money in the stock market crash! Go on! Get outta here!
lessons.descriptionDesc:
A: Hello, I’m here to see Mr. Corleone.
B: Right this way, sir.

C: Charlie! What can I do for you?
B: Mr. Corlone, I’m really sorry to trouble you, but I need your help.
C: Anything for you, Charlie! Your father was like a brother to me.
B: Well, sir, you see, this recession has hit me pretty hard; I lost my job and I’m in a lot of debt.
C: I see……
B: Yeah, you know, I’ve got credit card bills, car payments, I’ve got to pay my mortgage; and on top of all that, I have to pay my son’s college tuition.
C: So you’re asking for a loan.
B: Well, I just thought maybe you could help me out.
C: What? At a time like this? I’m broke too, you know! You’re not the only one who has been hit by the recession! I lost half my money in the stock market crash! Go on! Get outta here!

cards.question:
- I can't even afford to fix my car! -----------------.

کامل کنید: زیر بار قرضم. (۴ کلمه)
cards.description: If you owe money to someone, you're in debt.

cards.question:
- The country is experiencing a ------------.The economy is very bad.

کامل کنید: رکود اقتصادی
cards.description:
A recession is a period of time when the economy of a country is doing badly.
In a recession, people lose their job and start spending less money, companies close or go bankrupt and their stock market prices fall.

cards.question:
- Can you lend me some money? 
+ No, I'm sorry, I'm -------.

کامل کنید: ورشکسته
cards.description: If you're broke, you have no money.

cards.question:
- I wanna buy a car but I don't have enough money.
+ Why don't you get a --------?

کامل کنید: وام
cards.description: When you borrow money, you get a loan.

cards.question:
- Are you happy with your new house?
+ Yes! But I'm going to have to pay its --------- for years.

کامل کنید: وام مخصوص برای خرید خانه. (یک کلمه)
cards.description: A mortgage is a type of loan for a house or property.

cards.question:
- The divorce --------------, I'm very depressed. 

کامل کنید: ضربه خیلی سختی بهم زد. (۴ کلمه)
cards.description:
Hit me pretty hard.
Hit me hard.

Pay attention to these examples:

- This cold hit me pretty hard, I've been in bed for a week.

- The news of my aunt's death hit me hard, I've been crying for days.

cards.question:
- I found a part time job, I need to save up for my -----------.

کامل کنید: شهریه
cards.description: The money you pay to school to study there.

cards.question:
What is a more formal way of saying "Can I help you?"

(۶ کلمه)
cards.reply: What can I do for you?
cards.description: "What can I do for you?" is a more polite and natural way of saying "Can I help you?" or "What do you need?".

cards.question:
- Can I ---------------- for a moment? I just need you to sign this form for me.

کامل کنید. (مزاحم تون بشم/وققتون رو بگیرم) (۲کلمه)
cards.description:
Pay attention to these examples:

- I'm really sorry to trouble you, may I go home early today?

- Can I trouble you for a pen? Mine is not working.

cards.question: - Today, I lost my job, my car got stolen, and -------------------, my girlfriend broke up with me.
cards.description:
On top of all that is a way of saying "and also".

For example:

- I had the best day! It was my birthday and my friends all came to celebrate, and on top of all that, I got a lot of presents!

lessons.title: In A Restaurant!
lessons.storyDesc:
- Good evening, my name is Sophia. I'll be your waitress for tonight. May I take your order?
+ No, I'm still working on it. This menu is not even in English. What's good here?
- For you sir, I would recommend spaghetti and meatballs.
+ Does it come with Coke and fries?
- It comes with either soup or salad and a complimentary glass of wine, sir.
+ I'll go with spaghetti and meatballs, salad, and the wine.
- Excellent choice! your order will be ready soon
+ How soon is soon?
- 20-minutes.
+ You know what?! I'll just go grab a burger across the street.
lessons.descriptionDesc:
- Good evening, my name is Fabio. I'll be your waiter for tonight. May I take your order?
+ No, I'm still working on it. This menu is not even in English. What's good here?
- For you sir, I would recommend spaghetti and meatballs.
+ Does it come with Coke and fries?
- It comes with either soup or salad and a complimentary glass of wine, sir.
+ I'll go with spaghetti and meatballs, salad, and the wine.
- Excellent choice! your order will be ready soon
+ How soon is soon?
- 20-minutes.
+ You know what?! I'll just go grab a burger across the street.
 
waiter -> male
waitress -> female

cards.question:
- Did you finish reading the magazine?
+ No, ------------------------------.

پاسخ بدین هنوز دارم روش کار می کنم.
cards.description:
I'm still working on it means that I still need more time.

For example:

- Did you fix my car?
+ I'm still working on it.

cards.question:
- What's good here?
+ The burger is great! It comes with -----------.

پاسخ بدین کوکاکولا و سیب زمینی سرخ کرده (به اختصار)
cards.description: Coke and fries is short for Coca-Cola and French fries, which is a popular American dish.

cards.question:
- You must try the spaghetti here. It comes with either soup or salad and ------------------.

پاسخ بدین یک گیلاس شراب مجانی.
cards.description:
One of the meanings of the word complimentary is free.
Make sure not to confuse the word "complimentary" with "complementary".
Complimentary can mean both free or flattering.
Complementary means harmonizing or complementing.

cards.question:
- Would you rather have soup or salad?
- I'll take the salad.

در مکالمه بالا چه عبارتی می‌تواند جایگزین 
I'll take
شود؟
cards.description: I'll go with means I'm choosing or I'll take.

cards.question:
let's ------ a cup of coffee.

جمله بالا را با یک کلمه کامل کنید.
(to get something quickly)
cards.description:
grab means to get something quickly.

pay attention to these examples:

- Wait for me please I have to grab my coat.

- On your way home can you grab some milk please.
